alert.note: Alert for Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 10:04AM EST until February 28 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Williamsburg affecting Whitley County. For the Cumberland River...including Cumberland, Baxter, Pineville, Barbourville, Williamsburg...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Williamsburg. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Flooding threatens low lying roads and structures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Sunday the stage was 22.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM EST Sunday was 24.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 7.2 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.2 feet on 01/11/1965. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued at 7 PM on Sunday, February 27th.
